materials.raw_text: Cs: 12 g, Fe: 12.8 g, S: 16 g, Se: 32 g, Ti: 8 g

sourcing.instructions: Cs: Obtain from a chemical supplier specializing in alkali metals. Fe: Available from metal suppliers or online marketplaces. S: Source from a chemical supply company. Se: Procure from a chemical supplier or electronics component store. Ti: Available from metal suppliers or specialty chemical stores.
steps: Cs: Obtain from a chemical supplier specializing in alkali metals. Fe: Available from metal suppliers or online marketplaces. S: Source from a chemical supply company. Se: Procure from a chemical supplier or electronics component store. Ti: Available from metal suppliers or specialty chemical stores.

1. In a fume hood, carefully measure 12 g of cesium (Cs) using gloves and goggles. 2. Measure 12.8 g of iron (Fe) powder. 3. Weigh 16 g of sulfur (S) and 32 g of selenium (Se). 4. Finally, measure 8 g of titanium (Ti) powder. 5. Combine all measured materials in a clean, dry ceramic or glass container. 6. Mix thoroughly using a ceramic spatula until a uniform powder is obtained.
preparation.raw_text: 1. In a fume hood, carefully measure 12 g of cesium (Cs) using gloves and goggles. 2. Measure 12.8 g of iron (Fe) powder. 3. Weigh 16 g of sulfur (S) and 32 g of selenium (Se). 4. Finally, measure 8 g of titanium (Ti) powder. 5. Combine all measured materials in a clean, dry ceramic or glass container. 6. Mix thoroughly using a ceramic spatula until a uniform powder is obtained.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a high-temperature furnace or crucible. 2. Heat the mixture gradually to 800 °C at a rate of 5 °C/min. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of Cs12Fe2S4Se8Ti2.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a high-temperature furnace or crucible. 2. Heat the mixture gradually to 800 °C at a rate of 5 °C/min. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of Cs12Fe2S4Se8Ti2.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally. 2. Avoid opening the furnace until it reaches around 200 °C to prevent oxidation or contamination.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally. 2. Avoid opening the furnace until it reaches around 200 °C to prevent oxidation or contamination.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use sandpaper (320 grit) to smooth out rough edges and surfaces. 3. If required, seal the material with an appropriate chemical-resistant sealant for protection. 4. Store the final product in a desiccator to prevent moisture absorption.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use sandpaper (320 grit) to smooth out rough edges and surfaces. 3. If required, seal the material with an appropriate chemical-resistant sealant for protection. 4. Store the final product in a desiccator to prevent moisture absorption.
